name: Marilyn Singer
bio:
Children’s book author Marilyn Singer earned a BA in English from Queens College, City University of New York, and an MA in communications from New York University. She has written more than 90 books for children and young adults, roughly a third of them poetry. She writes about a variety of subjects, including science, animals, and school.
A selection of her award-winning poetry titles includes Turtle in July (1989), a Time magazine Best Children’s Book; On the Same Day in March (2000), named one of Booklist’s Top 10 Science Books of 2000 and an NCSS-CBC Notable Book; Creature Carnival (2004), a Lee Bennett Hopkins Poetry Award Honor Book; Central Heating: Poems About Fire and Warmth (2005), an ALSC Notable Book; and Mirror Mirror: A Book of Reversible Verse (2010), winner of the Cybil Award for Poetry.
Singer lives in Brooklyn, New York, with her husband and various pets.
